Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pumpkin Pierogies

MKNc5A9BT6VLX-XKULwesw.text: We went for dinner and drinks, and it was phenomenal!  The inside is decorated nicely, which gave it a pleasant vibe right off the bat.  Our waitress was super friendly and patient as we decided on drinks and dinner.  The cocktails were good, and the food was even better!  I ordered the jerk shrimp and scallops with grits, and my boyfriend got the hanger steak.  Everything had great flavor and was cooked to perfection.  I had such a wonderful experience and I will absolutely be back!

JWs8aMzkHYpB1IRGFbLUQw.text: This place was great. Was walking along the river and found some outdoor seating here. It took a little while for someone to find us outside but once they did our waitress was great, super friendly. They have a decent draft list. I needed a snack and the Brussel sprouts really hit the spot, they have peanuts on them. Checked out the inside, this place is fairly big inside. Overall a pretty good experience.

36SYUGzmgKZ9Wt251LW4OQ.text: Cool place to go before a Steelers game. The place is big so it accommodates a lot of people, and it didn't feel overly crowded. See if you can grab a seat at the bar--otherwise, be prepared to be quoted a wait time of 1 hour before a football game.  They have a pretty decent selection of beers on tap. I tried the Rosemary's Baby Pumpkin Ale. It was pretty good but not great.  We didn't order food but the burgers and brunch food that went by on servers' platters looked really good.  We will definitely go back in a few weeks and order food. And I will remember to get there around 10:30am ish or so to make sure we get a table and have enough time to eat.  Unlike a lot of other places nearby, the Foundry doesn't get as loud as other bars and restaurants which is really nice. If you don't want to order restaurant food, they grill brats and other grab-n-go food items on the patio.  Good call.

TeCDZpLrUnNnspyavRq13Q.text: First time visiting. Wanted to grab some food before the Penguins game this evening. Got the Foundry Burger. Tasted delicious!!!

ralu60cbt5hysK2kxhDoUA.text: It was fine.  I had the market salad and a beer - both were good, but not amazing, and definitely not $20 worth.   I did really like the cheese in the salad, but wish there was a crouton of some sort, because it needed a crunch element.   I do really appreciate how great the service was -  very quick (and they were hosting my running group, so about 30-40 people) - very fun ambiance with outdoor as well as indoor seating.  It looked like there was a nice area for groups inside as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Market salad

td7mLnB2bkjlO-oqcVVPXw.text: Excited to try The Foundry..   Friday night happy hour..  wasnt too crowded but figured the crowd probably ranges with whatever is happening in the north shore. I was glad it wasnt packed. I love the feel of Foundry.. really like the wood and urban feel.  You dont realize how big the establishment is walking in ..  theres a bar in the front area.. very cozy feel but walking down the hall to the back area..  complete dining space with plenty of seating and nice size bar.   Sat a the bar was greeted by the bartender "Keith" . .. want to give a shout out for great service and being so great with answering all my questions.    FOOD:  I was surprised at the menu size and selection. I thought there would be a lot more options but not dis-crediting the menu.  Its just more typical to have more options but sometimes "less is more".  I had a feeling the prices would be above average and they were.   Roasted pumpkin pierogis:   very different and good. Its not a dish I would get again. The portion is very small.    I loved the grilled cheese.  This was impressive.. the cheese on it really made my taste buds sing.   The fries were good and definitely unforgettable.  There are some unique items on the menu such as a meat and cheese board! I love that.    I really wanted to try the Korean fried wings but wish they weren't the whole wing.To drain i had the the VoodooBrewing - "GranMet" - Belgian Tripel -oh it was so tasty.   PARKING: I parked in the lot behind Burgatory and for about three hours it was $7.00 not too bad.    It was a great first experience at The Foundry Table and Tap.  This place is so ideal for a group gathering or happy hour.  I see another visit in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

B_NlfISSFc8udebQNyXJgg.text: My friend was in town for a conference and was staying down the street at the Hilton. I met her for a late dinner/drinks and we didn't know where to go. As we walked down the street a few of the places called to us but we have already hit them up before and wanted to try out something new, maybe something exciting. The Foundry was where we decided to go. It was pretty empty for the time of night so we got seated outside really fast.   The first bad experience was something that maybe they had no control over but was irritating none the less. We sat outside and when I sat down there was a crack in the table and when the table moved all of the rain water that was just chilling there from the day or day before spilled all over my pants. Ok, not cool, but not terrible. Until it continued to happen every time the table was bumped. My own fault we should have moved but I honestly thought every time that it happened would be the last.   I was hungry and asked the waitress what would be here suggestion. I was between items on the menu and needed her assistance. With her assistance I went with the Bahn Mi sandwich and a side of fries.   ROAST PORK BANH MI: cucumber, pickled vegetables, cilantro, jalapeno, baguette. This is where I went wrong. This sandwich was awful. There were little to no picked veggies,  little to no jalapenos, a ton of cilantro. The bread was WAY to thick and dry for the sandwich and it felt like it was taking all of the moisture out of my mouth. I ripped the bread in half and still felt like choking on it. I ended up just taking the meat off the bun and eating it with no bread. Ugh. The roast pork is not roasted pork as one would think it was pulled pork with a bbq like sweet sauce. Nothing like regular bahn mi's meat is usually made. It was just blah. The fries though were on point. They were garlicky and delish. I enjoyed them a lot. That sandwich though was the worst. Blah, that is a good word to describe it,  I do not know if I would come back just based upon that terrible sandwich. I mean, I always want to give places another shot but that and the fact that my pants were soaked by the end of the dinner just gave me this bad impression.   I wish that I had a better time. The location and the views were beautiful, I just need a good reason to come here.

cJLY3mgXCAhxIxdDRdNAUg.text: Went here before a concert on the North Shore. Sat down and had multiple bartenders walk right past us and not ask us if we would like a menu or to get started with a drink. After flagging down a bartender, he gave us menus and took our drink order. It took about 10 minutes for 2 beers to be brought to us. It took another 15 minutes for him to come back to see if we wanted to place a food order. Our food came out pretty quickly and the server attempted to serve it to some ladies with low cut shirts on who were busy taking shots, when they said it wasn't there's he placed the dishes behind the bar. Multiple bartenders reached over and around our food until we again had to flag down our bartender and ask for our food to be delivered. Once delivered, my meal was wrong -- the bartender stated he would correct this and not charge me for this item. The girls next to us had 3 bartenders serving them the entire night and had multiple shots lined up. Maybe it's because they were dressed a tad provocative and the bartenders were all 20s something men. We felt terribly neglected the entire time.   This was after we had a really great first visit. We asked for our check, when he brought us the check he took $3 off of the meal they messed up and I had to question this. He tried to explain he wasn't charging me for the roast beef he failed to add but was still charging me for the entire meal. After voicing my complaints he had the bartender manager come talk to me. He was nice and pretended to listen and was able to compensate me fairly well and take a round of drinks off of the bill. However, he was also one of the bartenders who ignored us our entire visit.   I'm not sure when it became okay to not take care of all of your patrons the same but definitely felt bad leaving the bar. I'm not sure if I will be back which is sad because I appreciate their beer choices

cr77-LJ8VoZvR73qU7F_bA.text: We visited the Foundry for brunch and loved it!   Our table shared a few brunch appetizers, including the pork belly bites, duck confit haluski, and the scotch egg. Everything was so delicious, I would have been happy to keep sampling appetizers. Entree orders varied around the table, with a little bit of everything. I personally had the huevos rancheros, which was among the best I've had since living in the southwest. Our son had chicken fingers and fries but there were a few other options for kids as well - so this is a great brunch option for the whole family.   A few of us did the bloody mary bar, which featured, among other additions, giant perfect slabs of pepper bacon. The other drink options are widely varied, providing something for everyone.  The decor is very clean and contemporary; and, the service was excellent. Add in the location on the North Shore, with plenty of good views and walking paths, and The Foundry is an ideal location for brunch.   We absolutely plan on going back!

jp540bRU1vnR7tkD0vFMYg.text: Our bartender, Jordan was extremely friendly and nice. I'm so happy I took my parents to this place because their beer selection is fantastic and Jordan made our visit very special by not only helping us to find the best beers but also by entertaining us. Definitely recommend every beer lover to stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bar area (but they have more beers on the draft than the pic shows)

9AauEL-gxaBqhSaaoTJSrQ.text: Ate here twice during a business trip. Overall good pub food. I most recently had the salmon burger which was delicious. Portions are generous. Good beer selection but they were out of my first two choices which was too bad. Very nice outdoor seating but can't quite see the river. Service was good for our large party of 8+

5iv8w8NbdnwZTScZiyunow.text: Great service first and really great dinner, The Cuban sandwich was spot on and the shrimp and scallops dinner was excellent. Sat outside and enjoyed  a great end to summer before the Pitt game- go Pitt!

rRWbpcI451IryTqWvHQMyg.text: First time here. Love the decor, very industrial/farm style. The burger was excellent and service was great too. I also ordered the Regal drink, tasted like a Carmel Apple and it was pretty good. Everyone I came with enjoyed everything they ordered. Lots of outdoor space, we will be back when the weather warms

O6wDhQGvYJk8RTpFITERSw.text: Great food! Fancy looking with delight taste. Came with PITT Arts so I didn't pay for anything. It seems expensive here but the food for sure is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Appetizer

Djphk5yLY24bJJr_KKz3UA.text: Could not get the attention of the bartenders to save my life. The main guy on staff literally said zero words to us the whole time as we ordered (no greeting, etc).... we left and went to another bar.  Their food is good if you can get them to listen to you though!

c4lcJ5Gf0CbJacyTOYwxMw.text: I came here after a Pirates game and waited 30 minutes for a table. Once we were seated, I was disappointed to be lead into the back area and see an almost empty restaurant!   Service was slow, food was salty, and our drinks were always empty for at least 20 minutes. In all we spent 2.5 hours for a couple burgers and drinks.

8j6w536pRVSsNu3Kjpqdmg.text: Made a reservation before a concert to grab dinner. I ordered the Cuban sandwich and Brussels sprouts. Both were good, but nothing extraordinary. My husband got the Bibb salad with grilled chicken. I thought the chicken was dry, but he enjoyed it overall. We had a few drinks with dinner that we enjoyed. I guess the food was good, but overpriced. The waitress was busy, but attentive. It took a while for my husband to get his drink, but everything else was delivered reasonably fast.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cuban and Fried Brussels Sprouts Dinner

weFzok9ZPUhzzyM4WlvxOw.text: If I could leave a negatice I would. It is game day understandable that there are waits but the host staff was rude and refused to put parties of 2 on a list. Being our party has disabilities it makes it hard to push towards the bar and fight for a seat. Treat patrons with respect as we were leaving there was an older couple (50s) that were a party of 2 and they got on the list.

S2ZNP80zvVSCwI1fy-VFhg.text: Went here for brunch, not as busy as I expected. Excellent food & atmosphere! Staff was very friendly. Bloody Mary's were awful though, one of the worst I've ever had.

otkGXHAZvKJzx3fjnM_30g.text: After a particularly long bike ride, this place hit the spot. Yes, yes, I was beyond hungry so maybe any food would have been received with total pleasure but I stand by my taste buds and stomach's total satisfaction.  I ordered a burger and fries and, seriously, this was in the top echelon of burgers -- cooked to perfection and moist.  And the fries were seasoned perfectly.  I will say I cannot believe they advertise the burger with American cheese as the only option.  That seems a bit sub-par (more than sup-bar, actually).  I was bold enough to ask for cheddar, thank goodness, so I'd ask you to do the same!  Oh, and I also had a bloody mary.  It was spicy enough to my liking.  The only sad-face part -- no celery available upon my request.  Sigh....  All in all, a nice restaurant/bar, especially if you want to watch a game on TV.  (The Steelers had just finished their game prior to our arrival which was good in a way -- the place was cleared out of patrons so no wait and our choice of tables!)

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burger
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bloody Mary but no celery. Sad face.

ySiGGZabLZrTxw5-A6MLyg.text: I feel like this place should be killing it in this location with a decent menu, but they have the worst service. They seem really understaffed and the hostess and servers all looked like they were about to drop dead from stress.

XVFgG2cJBoHSo-9Imry_fQ.text: The Foundry is a trendy restaurant located on the North Shore. My friends and I met here on a Sunday evening. It wasn't busy at all and we were seated right away. I started with the House Ale, which was a pale ale - just what I like! The table shared the pimento cheese dip. I actually liked this a lot. It was served with pickled vegetables and crackers! For my meal, I had the fried chicken breast sandwich. It was huge! But so delicious. The fries that were paired with my sandwich were also really good. I liked my meal and the atmosphere, but the rest of the menu were things I'm not crazy about ordering.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

qrjfW5-JjssLlOYu3FtIsQ.text: Server was good, food was very well done packed with flavor. Only downside was they were out of a lot of beers. But made up for it by having service that made good recommendations.

QQvz10zC6tycjha5ySoT9w.text: Our first time in Pittsburgh. Attending the Garth Brooks concert. HUGE crowds. They told us 1.5 hr wait. OK totally get that. We were seated with in that time. Our food took a little while but the entire staff was friendly and made sure we were ok. Our food was AMAZING. We had the grass-fed burger. Highly recommend that and the white Sangria. We hope to roll back into Pittsburgh someday and stop in.  Such a friendly and professional staff. Thank you for such great service under a stressful atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. White Sangria

j3juzaqapEz1M8ARqcmdow.text: We did not eat there, but the food looked great. The atmosphere was awesome. The only reason I'm giving this a so so review is due to one thing.. the smell. It smelled HORRIBLY in there. I can't describe it. It was almost like stale something or puke. I wish I was kidding. It's why I didnt order any food. Bummer.

oaoYatwxv61E9MKCPR2dTA.text: I don't find myself over on the North Shore too often but my work has used The Foundry for a few happy hours. Last time I was there it was a Thursday evening and the bartender told us that their rock-paper-scissors happy hour, if you won you got a free drink! It definitely added a bit of excitement and engagement with the bartender. At other happy hours we have hosted we order a few appetizers for the tables since we have so many guests. I was disappointed by the food options at The Foundry. They certainly have a creative menu which is great if that's what you are looking for but there weren't any good shareable options that everyone liked. A few examples were marinated olives, pork belly bites, and honey roasted bar nuts which a few people ordered but we were hoping for a more traditional chips and salsa or an appetizer plate featuring a few options which would have been great for a large party such as ours.  The beer selection is great and the restuarant sits right off the river. During the warmer months in Pittsburgh sitting outside and enjoying a cocktail would be beautiful.

J0X2q3fFJKxV2ovv1VHlhQ.text: This is going to be a mixed review. The food was very good (sausage breakfast sandwich) although the menu is pretty limited so be prepared for that. I ordered a bloody mary which I was under the impression would be built at the "bloody mary bar" that our waitress had mentioned. The glass was served to me very full so the point of the bloody mary bar was...confusing at best. Plus, of the few scant garnishes that were up there, there were no skewers or a small plate or even a dang napkin to put any of the garnishes on. The bloody mary had more horseradish than I would put in an entire pitcher. It was CHUNKY and nearly impossible to choke down. Service was average at best. I was just visiting Pitts so I won't be back regardless but I'd probably would patronize other places if I were a local.

3a6w2WeUvl5FYVDUrjJPsw.text: Stopped here for dinner before the Ween concert because they were running a promo for a free drink when you presented your ticket.  This was my first time here (actually I didn't even know this place existed before seeing the promo), and I really enjoyed the space, the drink list, and the food.  My server was very friendly, and she made some recommendations, and I ended up pairing the Sauteed trout w/cukes, potatoes, dill, and mustard seeds with a Rusty Rail Cucumber Ale, and they couldn't have complimented each other any better.  The food and drink were awesome, albeit kind of small portions on the cukes and potatoes, so I was still hungry after eating it, and then had a most wonderful dessert of Pannacotta, and it was fabulous.  Since this is a farm-to-table restaurant, the prices were a little higher than some other places in the area, but not too extravagant.  My meal with tip (including the free beer) was $40, so not outrageous.   The space itself is really nice, and felt comfortable and casual.  I'd recommend this spot, and hope to come back again some time when I am over on the North Shore . . . Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dessert menu . . .
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Spicy Brussels Sprouts . . .
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pierogies . . .

KiR1wa7P_L6bvfHGAp5o0g.text: DO NOT HOST PRIVATE EVENTS HERE. I have been to two private events here, and both events were poorly executed by the staff. Both events were a buffet style brunch. Eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, French toast, and potatoes were served. At both events, they ran out of food twice... The events took way longer than necessary due to the staff replacing food, refilling drinks, etc. I HIGHLY recommend against this restaurant as a venue for a private party. The staff is not flexible and do not check on the guests, or food once it's served. I am extremely disappointed and will not return.

Bzx4nTi58n7tjpuNELKjIQ.text: Stopped here while walking the river trail with my husband for lunch on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and I'm glad we did! Huge building, much bigger than it appears to be, and great atmosphere. The food took a little while to come out so we were offered a drink or dessert on the house! Small food menu but huge beer selection. The food tasted great and our waitress was very sweet and efficient. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Chicken Sandwich
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bibb Salad

7rydt6sc38Xd4AWPiDJRqg.text: Awesome happy hour drink specials!  The mussels with the spicy red sauce was delicious and a tasty change from the typical butter sauce you usually get with mussels. The general tso cauliflower was the best! The appetizer portion wasn't enough, I wanted more because it was so good!  Friendly staff Will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pei Mussels
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salmon BLT

-2ozAy_nvDZ27PGNnjMzRw.text: This was my first time here, and I really enjoyed it!  The service was phenomenal, and the food and drinks were very good.  It was quick, too.  I was pleasantly surprised overall by how much we enjoyed everything.      For libations, we tried their signature drinks The Hayworth and the one with the orange patron, pomegranate and orange peel (actually...had a "few" of these...).  I can't remember their "name" for it, though...but they were both EXCELLENT.  We went during Happy Hour, so their signature drinks were only $5 each.  I thought this was a pretty good deal.    For the delicious food, we had the Sirloin steak that was paired with swiss chard, local mushrooms and roasted potatoes.  I felt the steak dish was a little pricey for the portion and what you got, however, it was better quality ingredients, which you obviously need to pay for.  We also tried the grilled cheese sandwich (which was one of the best i've had).  The grilled cheese had a mixture of cheddar and monterey jack, and a delightful layer of locally made apple butter!  I was shocked at how good this was.  This came with some pretty awesome fries, too.  All in all, I would go back in an instant.  It was a great atmosphere, and the food and drinks were very good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Hayworth and the &#34;awesome orange one that I can&#39;t remember the name of&#34;.

-XOxyIOK3UAqcjlKePe2cA.text: Great place to meet before a game.   The food is very good.  I had the creamed corn and gumbo.  Strange mix but it was really good   My son had the Salmon BLT and he reported that is was really well done and tasty  Now a down side.  The chairs outside are very uncomfortable.  Not good for hanging out.

UdTvb2GWlHdV5Kpi8AlCrg.text: Came here with my fiance and my father to grab a bite to eat before a Pirate game. I've only ever been here for beverages, so I was excited to finally try it out for the food.  We were greeted and seated right away. We were there early before the game so there wasn't many people in the restaurant yet. It's very spacious inside and has space to sit and eat in the front of the restaurant and in the back of the restaurant. A very large party of 15 very loud and very drunk men were seated beside us a few minutes after being sat. I mean there's a whole restaurant with lots of space and MANY tables available. So that was irritating to us since we could barely hear each other talks.  Our service was OK. Our server was very blah and a tad rude - she seemed bothered by customers and gave the vibe that she didn't really want to be there.  As far as food goes, I ordered the haluski, brussel sprouts, and pierogies. My fiance is not from Pittsburgh so I wanted him to try pierogies and I will say that I was pleased. The brussel sprouts were delicious. I liked the haluski, but wasn't the biggest fan of the flavor that the duck confit gave it. That's just my personal opinion. My dad however liked it. My fiance and I were not pleased with the Mac n cheese. It was dry and cheese was sprinkled on top. It wasn't even mixed in or anything. It's like they put noodles in a pan and sprinkled cheese on top and called it mac n cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Brussel sprouts, Pierogies, and Duck Confit Haluski Lunch

rbudl0h6gcI6bJHkFVcxZg.text: The food was overpriced for average. I had a spinach salad with chicken, the portion size seemed small. I also ordered a soda water with lime, which did not come from a bottle, and was charged four dollars. $24.00 for a small spinach salad with chicken and soda water from the tap. If the salad had been anything but average, I wouldn't have even bothered to write this review. The atmosphere was nice though.

ce2joIjPlwCdGETc6BZdYg.text: I loved sitting outside on the patio, the food was ok but I was expecting more to be honest. The burgers and sandwiches look great, but the mushroom risotto I ordered came up a little short. There wasn't much flavor at all. The walleye was positioned over a bed of croutons which I also found odd. Best part about the meal was the pirogies, I would definitely order those again!

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lake Erie Walleye
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pirogies

hBp5GDdqrfNHklqRIqyD6Q.text: Review for happy hour only.  I came here with a large group for a week day happy hour. I immediately noticed the great interior and large space. There was plenty of space to sit or stand inside with the optional outside area as well. It over looks part of the city and the river. It is close (easily walkable) to Heinz Field, Stage AE, and many other restaurants and bars. They have a side room that is pretty large and looks like they reserve it for large parties and events.    During happy hour the cocktails were discounted (can't remember if it was half off or they were all $5) which I thought was a fair price and good deal. I will say that the cocktail that the waitress strongly suggested did not taste particularly good, but they had a large amount of options to choose from. She really emphasized the fresh muddled blueberries so I was envisioning something fresh and light, instead it tasted a little artificial. It might have just not been my style of drink. I would like to return to try their food and other drinks that they have.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0NsDtcg_1jDz15K-aicU3w.text: Not much to complain about for a nice brunch place.  * Food: We came here on a Sunday afternoon and surprisingly, there wasn't many people (probably due to Pittsburgh weather). I couldn't resist ordering the Huevos Rancheros as our waitress said it was a restaurant favorite and it had fried eggs. I'm not a huge fan of potatoes because it's usually not seasoned well but theirs was delicious. It also had pulled pork which was just a tiny bit salty but nonetheless pretty good.       * Cost vs. Worth: Their brunch menu is about $11-$14 with the highest being $24 (steak). That range is about average for a nice brunch dish.   Will I come here again? - Yes. The brunch menu was small but I would come here again to try the main entrees!

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huevos Rancheros

raFMLkG4telxNYgHQGaEKA.text: Great Happy Hour spot! They have awesome deals until 6pm. Half off drafts and $5 cocktails. If you walk in and it looks empty, walk to the back bar, that's where everyone will be. It's a casual and modern atmosphere that you feel comfortable hanging out in with friends. We ordered the poutine to share. Every day they have a different type, but they had buffalo chicken when we were there. It was pretty good. The fries were a bit overdone, but there was plenty of cheese and chicken on top to cover every bite. If there are more than 3 people in your group, I recommend getting a few appetizers to share, portions are small.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Buffalo Chicken Poutine

y8ChKRbew2zZjfV41A5ofA.text: I met my family here for dinner on a Wednesday evening after they were at the Carnegie Science Center.  We weren't sure where to eat because we had 2 kids in our party and didn't know if this establishment would be kid-friendly.  We decided to try it anyhow and they do offer a kid's menu.  The restaurant wasn't very busy and I believe this made our experience so much better.  I read some of the other reviews and it seemed that patrons visited during the game and were disappointed because the service was slow.    My family & relatives arrived at the restaurant before me and said they were greeted and seated promptly. They ordered appetizers until I arrived, which were  the General Tso's Cauliflower appetizer and my son asked if they had any breadsticks appetizers, the server Codie stated that they did not.  However; when he delivered the Cauliflower appetizer they also brought out some sort of cheesy bread bites for the kids at no charge.  The boys were so excited and happy, my family was really impressed, and they said they were delicious.    When I finally arrived I was greeted immediately by Codie, who was very attentive, smiled often, and was really friendly during our entire dining experience.  He explained that happy hour was almost over and gave me the rundown of all of the happy hour specials.  I decided on a cocktail (I can't remember the name) which was only $5 and I ordered another appetizer- the Poutine of the day, which was pulled pork.  We all thought it was really good.  The fries were really crunchy and the pulled pork and cheese put the dish over the top.   For dinner I selected the Grilled Cheese, Side of Tomato Bisque, and a small side salad with the house dressing.  I really enjoyed the grilled cheese dipped in the bisque, the flavors really complimented one another.  I did not like the bisque on it's own as it was on the sweeter side, but it made a great "dip" for the grilled cheese.  The house dressing was good, but thicker than I expected.    My sister-in-law ordered the beet salad and she loved it.  My brother-in-law had a side of the fried Brussel sprouts and said they were some of the best he's ever eaten.  My relatives currently live in Georgia and said it was one of the best meals they've had in a long time. They were also really excited about the locally sourced ingredients, too.   The combination of the service, quality, taste of the food, and the decor has earned this 5 star review.  We all agreed that we can't wait to go back. If you visit, ask to sit in Codie's section.  He was fantastic and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tomato Bisque
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cocktail
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Kids menu

Ud5li-cZXlLh2NEDCM1K7A.text: My mother in law wanted a nice low key dinner and her coworker suggested this place...I was hungry because I had skipped lunch and didn't care where we went   I do have to say that I like the farmhouse yey industrial vibe of the place. It's also very spacious; a good place for groups to get together. Also the music is REALLY low so it's not too loud; might be a nice place for a date or just dinner so you can actually chat with your partner and hear them.   Our waitress was extremely friendly which I appreciated and quick. I got the spicy mule (pretty standard, I wasn't blown away but it was refreshing with the spicy kick I was expecting based off of the ingredients), my mother in law asked for "half cranberry, half ginger ale with a lime"...the presentation of this mocktail was cute, even though they put a lemon instead of the lime she asked for.  We got the Yukon potato pierogis as appetizers...not gonna lie,  these were pretty bland...so was my medium well burger. I did enjoy my fries though. My mother in law said her grilled cheese was just ok (I think it's pretty difficult to mess up grilled cheese though) but her Brussels sprouts were absolutely too salty. We couldn't eat them at all, had to switch them out for a salad (with beer vinaigrette on the side). I'm wondering if the saltiness was a fluke.   By the time we had finished, we were so underwhelmed with how blah the meal was that my mother in law didn't even want to give the dessert menu a try. I honestly was just too full. She says she absolutely will not be back but I think maybe if I'm back in town again I might give them another try....not at the top of my list though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled cheese with a side if Brussels sprouts
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Burger and fries

EbP79jJ3PaHUtJgeW9ZfVw.text: Hosted a bridal shower there and I can not say enough great things about their staff. Great food, great location, and awesome mimosas. The GM was wonderful and so accommodating. If you're looking for somewhere to host an event I'd highly recommend this place!

jjDmVDZ02bf2gznCZ8E-0A.text: Just wanted to thank the management, servers, bartenders and the entire staff of the foundry. I just had a large company/group event there. I booked it at fairly late notice and the foundry team took care of everything. Gave me guidance on what would be a good set up and came through 100% to what they committed.

CEwDj3RY8YcT3gXNOJJVsQ.text: The Foundry describes itself as a gastropub, which I think is a nice trendy way of saying it serves delicious food, solid craft beer and strong mixed cocktails. It does all of this and it does it well.  The front waiting room was a little bare, so I was worried I was in the wrong place, but thankfully a host found me and led me to the back, which is where all the magic happens.  I sat at the bar, which was fully stocked with quality libations. In addition, the beer list was fairly expansive and included a nice variety of styles from both regional and national craft breweries. I visited during happy hour so all draft beers were half off which was a nice perk.  Foodwise, there are plenty of options and they're quite filling. The menu is straight forward with normal American dishes including apps, sandwiches and some main courses. The bartender recommended the pierogis, which are a Pittsburgh delicacy.  Unfortunately I didn't take her advice because I didn't want to ruin my dinner, but a gentleman down the bar made sure to let me know I was making a mistake. I'll take his word on it. I ended up ordering a special, which was a chopped up steak sandwich and a side of fries. Add in a couple of pilsners and I was a happy camper.  One quick note, I dined before a baseball game. While I enjoyed my visit, my meal and will highlight the happy hour, I'm not sure if it's the best pregame place. I will say, I do think it's a great happy hour and dinner venue. You will get your fill of food and it matches up well to the beers on tap. If you do stop before a game, I recommend eating a lighter dish.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

bsEjPrDdGe8pyYPysKW2Ow.text: I ENDORSE THIS RESTAURANT 150%!!!  My gf and I were visiting from Cali and wanted to try out a unique restaurant with flavorful personality where ones' thirst was deeply quenched from their selected cocktails and drinks.  Try the Jalapeno Mule!!  Cody was our waiter whom we thought could've been Sam Smiths' twin ...lol Nonetheless very friendly and had a lot of recommendations. I could've sworn he was British also,.. but he just happened to have a deep 'New Jersey accent'.  If any of you are a fan fried chicken sandwiches, I definitely would recommend ordering one from here!! Their sweet and spicy pepper relish seemed questionable at first but after the first bite, my taste buds danced with such delicious-delight. Fries are good, but Cody also recommended to try their Mac 'n cheese... wholly smokes! I was ready to die a happy man!!!  Alright that's enough 'song and a dance'...lol you get the pic

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried chicken sandwich with sub/Mac n cheese

QUVvWRuCklBz9onwjieeJg.text: Their selection of beer wasn't too bad. Had a lot of local brews which is what I was looking for.  My grilled cheese was simple but good. The fries were really good.  Also has some really nice outdoor seating.

5CMMRlI6-EkP4vgDIgkvYQ.text: OMG so good.  Excellent food and service on a game day.  Awesome bar tenders.  Eat at the bar.  Lottsa eye candy...

kxRjdqfvvEMkv5Xn5079SA.text: Popped in for a quick lunch since we were in the area.  Started with the pork belly bites which, although having tons of flavor and being super moist, were slightly over-glazed which made them stick to your teeth and very difficult to eat.  I then had the scallops in an nduja emulsion which, while flavorful were kind of stingily prepared. The 's' in 'scallops' obviously implied plural, and they were, all two of them which were cut in half for effect. I expected a bit more for the prices.  Service was spacey and kind of needed constant waving down to either take our order, get us refills and bring us the check.

8L_gYk70guSgYOfTLLJTIg.text: I love a place that serves brunch and The Foundry had a decent selection, great food, and wonderful service. We'll definitely go back to try other food. I'm interested in seeing their regular menu, though breakfast is my favorite meal of the day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. French toast with cream cheese topping
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Huevos rancheros

BtXa3oxvfDID5noWyxfViA.text: Good place for apps and a drink at the bar.  The apps are very small, but good.  Beer selection is great and the service is top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

v8oRcaWDvl75ZGIOymrD7w.text: THIS IS THAT REVIEW! I wish I had stars for different things- stopped in after the Steeler/Bengals game- Everywhere else was PACKED- Hostess gets a 10 - we asked about the wait - she said 30 minutes but encouraged us to come in to the bar which was crowded but we could move- actually found seats for 5 - NOTE TO OWNERS Bartender needs help - GREAT guy working his butt off both behind the bar and in front- we ended up with a table unless than 15 minutes- Great Table! Lots of tables about half full so busy but not slammed. However OWNERS YOU NEED MORE SERVERS! No service for well over 15-20 minutes- we finally got up and asked for a server and a very nice BUSY young man finally took our order! That was bad, we were so hungry and got really cranky! And then in less than 10 minutes our food arrived ALL at once hot and Delicious - One of our best meals in Pitt. We had the oysters, the pulled pork and I had the grilled cheese with bacon.  Everything was Great!  Once fed I began watching the flow - we had only 2 waiters for about 20 tables - not all full but really NOT enough staff- our waiter never returned to bring our check (because he was sooooo busy getting guests fed!) that we had to go find our check - we gave him a great tip because he really was doing all he could do - so staff 10 stars Food 10+ Stars Staffing person 1 Star - note to Owners - I know your new but STAFF UP!! It's better to have to pay a few extra employees while working out the kinks than have paying guests leave because of understaffing - Your wine list is better than most - Your Beer choices are good - I love the water bottles on the table and (although I had to go to the bar to get more water) I was very happy to receive 2 pre filled, cold bottles - your FOOD is AMAZING and so nice to have several waiters deliver the entire table hot food all at once.  The Foundry is welcome option to the North side - we will defiantly be back and hope your staffing issues are fixed.

_Qhx5SLka6D68JY2Yr8XbA.text: Ditto most of the previous review. The place has potential and the prices are good. I can't give any of the food superlatives, but it was better than many of the federal street places near PNC Park. Definitely looking for a different crowd than Asiago. We did have problems with the wait time. We didn't expect 1.5 hours for lunch, especially burgers and chicken sandwiches. Only real food fail were 2 burgers ordered medium well that came rare even after the long wait.I can't give two thumbs to the fries as they were broken pieces in a tin cup. They were cute but not worth getting out the thesaurus to describe their deliciousness.  Being perfectly fair the manager apologized and took the burger meals off the check, which was the right way to treat a customer, and appreciated.  They have only been open 5 days so I expect they need and deserve some time to work out the kitchen kinks. I'll try them again.

gi7h3GfPOOGOyBO2wGEudg.text: Great spot to go after the Steelers game. Looks like there's a nice outdoor area for sitting by the river. Nice beer selection and yummy food. It was a bit pricey though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Nice selection of beers

dKC2YvvRAUrea36cLRhc5g.text: A really cool building with a bar in the front and back and outdoor seating. I think the drafts were a little pricy. I had the grilled cheese with bacon. It was creamy and plenty cheesy. The bacon was decently thick slices crunchy but not so cooked that they shattered when you bit into the sandwich. The fries were perfectly seasoned. The foundry burger with a fried egg is a must. The beef blend was cooked perfectly to medium, juicy and flavorful. I would be interested in trying out their entrees and bar snacks too. A must stop if you're on the North Shore and want locally sourced food and not garbage from a chain restaurant.

WFFU9JeGeXdFrwjIh135Pg.text: I love farm to table restaurants so I was excited to try this one. Pretty disappointing. My wife is dairy free which limited her choices but typically works out okay. The chef adapted the fried chicken sandwich to be dairy free, while very nice was dry and lacked flavor. It did have an unusual spice on it, maybe cardamom, which was interesting but not enough to make it good. The fries, which people rave about in other reviews, were pretty tasty but still just French fries. Pork belly bites are good and even better, when paired with the brisket hash, although both needed salt to bring out the flavors. The highlight of my wife's meal was the drink She had, The Monroe. Light and refreshing. Go for drinks not for food.

xuGrlYSilME_vUYJy9u4QQ.text: This place was awesome! Great beer selection and super friendly server, Shayna. Loved the Korean BBQ wings and the grilled cheese. Definitely interested in trying some of the other items on the menu. I really like that you have the option to sit outside. I would imagine this is a fun place for some day drinking!

snxthTLvb7pV7wI-yzERdA.text: I'm sorry to say this has Ritz crackers served with pickles, onions and some dip. There happy hour is okay from 4-6.

cxf3Dc-DC6XL39M3MzzNEA.text: This was one of the best meals of my life. The staff was great, Raina was one of the most attentive servers we've ever had, and the chef was amazing. I highly recommend this place!

vMVx5ptsm6OuO0F9gCBBBQ.text: This was a great spot that we happened upon for the evening. They have a wonderful happy hour and the service was great. Even though the menu didn't look too different from any other menu, the food was outstanding.

vPab0s5XHigxxw5TijwVcA.text: Delicious food decen1t atmosphere with 2 bars! One quiet and one loud. My husband talks about this place all the time glad I finally got to try it ouy

wMMisR9mT9xKgBeCm2WF4A.text: Holy smokes is all i have to say! I wanted to try some new places around town so I did some searching around and decided to go with The Foundry in the northshore. I had no idea about the place so i asked my waitress, Maegan, what she recommended on the food menu and for dinner. Maegan recommended the foundry burger which was right in my wheel house. Nailed it! Very good! Not only was the food awesome but the service was even better! Making sure my experience was a great one and the recommendations were on point! Thanks again and i will for sure be back!

cfoZwCGHQ-RSsgCJoUcBiA.text: I have been twice, once in October for brunch/lunch, and once in September for dinner before a Cubs game. It was excellent food each time. At brunch I got their French toast, which was soaked in maple syrup and topped with a cheesecake sauce. Simple delicious. In September I got their pierogies and pulled pork. Again, delicious. The food is worth the price and they are a great find on the North Side.

50CMGzQP8-_zngJnNQybLw.text: We had our Engagement party (in lieu of a bridal shower) at the Foundry last June. From the menu planning to setting up the day of, the staff at the Foundry were incredible. Andrew was the primary contact for us. He helped us pick our menu selection (the salmon and creamed cauliflower were a hit with all who attended), as well as coordinate the open bar (the foundry offers a few bar set ups, including cash bar, drink tickets, and limits). Don't hesitate to consider them for an event for 50+ attendees. We had 55 for a sit down event and there was plenty of room for more.

VCncHwL7sukFF7p5vl8KTg.text: The ambiance is great! I had the Spring Vegetable Pho and is was light and refreshing! The fresh herbs really accentuated the broth...I didn't even miss the meat. The Buffalo Pork Rinds were ok. The Shishito Peppers were delicious. They could have a little bit of salt and it would've been perfect. My husband and I shared the Homemade Parpadelle and it was fantastic! The texture of the noodles were chewy and flavorful. You could tell the noodles were fresh and home made! I'll definitely be back again!

U3Hy7ttrqP0E8Jh7oV6arA.text: I came into Pittsburgh for the night for the annual Ohio University Christmas Party last November, and it was being hosted here. When I first got there, I thought that there was only one room in the front, but boy was I wrong - the place is freaking huge and super nice/new. We were situated in the back room with a long table right by the bar (perfect for OU Bobcats). The wait staff was super attentive and nice, considering there were about 30 of us who steadily got more and more drunk as the night progressed. They kept a constant variety of appetizers out for us to munch on, including a great meat/cheese tray and some delicious pumpkin pierogies. Thanks for the great service and the great night!

2D8l7TUW5umxvii3cvBkXg.text: Went in on a Thursday night place was nearly empty should have been our first inclination.  Way overpriced, tiny portions, weak drinks.  2 people bill was $100.00 and we were starving when we left.  Ridiculous.  The only positives were it was well decorated and spacious, the service was ok.  Friendly waitress.  Place won't be there very long.

jX0UrQr_dWJPYdHR4Rr2xQ.text: Met a group of friends on Friday evening for dinner & drinks. The beverage list had a nice mix of cocktails, wine & craft beers. We also ordered several food items. I definitely would suggest the Brussels Sprouts. The cheese board was also very good. Other's in the party ordered wings & grilled cheese and said they were okay. The interior of restaurant is very warm and inviting with reclaimed barn wood tables and seating. We actually liked it so much we planned a brunch at the end of the month for brunch. I hope they can establish a nice customer base. It is not crazy busy as of yet. Maybe just need to get word out!!!

UR4KXttTecCdrfW8ZhTj2w.text: I've been to the Foundry several times & it's never been anything but amazing!   From the minute i walked in the door, i loved everything about this place! The ambiance & decor are perfect! When being sat, I love that there are multiple different settings to choose from. On a nice day the best is being able to enjoy the awesome city and river views from the outdoor patio in the back! The bar area in the front was a great spot to meet up with friends & watch the game. Afterwards we went the the back to get some food.   Every time i've gone, we always split a bunch of things with the table because we couldn't decide on just one thing. Every dish we ordered was amazing! We all especially loved the pierogis, pickle brined fried chicken sandwich & the grilled cheese sandwich!! SO GOOD! We ate until we were all stuffed and couldn't believe how inexpensive our bill was, especially for such quality food! They'll be changing the menu regularly to match what is seasonally available and best so i can't wait to come back again & see what they come up with next! This place is exactly what the North Shore needed! It's not just another chain or mediocre bar food, it's locally owned and has a more upscale feel without going overboard! I highly recommend checking it out!

30U9skF6EdNfMApjC7tctw.text: I rarely give reviews, and unfortunately this time it's because we had a horrible experience.    It started well with us being asked to move outside because it was unseasonably warm for October and they accommodated us.  After that though, it was all downhill.  It took us a half hour to get our drinks.  The beer menu is average for what's on tap.  No sours on tap, but whatever, I ordered a grapefruit beer that they were out of.  We ordered apps that we waited and waited for. We asked where they were and got a "let me check" like we were bothering our waitress.  Not 30 seconds later our entrees came out.  No one was crazy about their food.  My fish was way sweeter than the menu let on.  Another thought the chicken sandwich was overdone, my wife said the steak was just okay.  Also "okay" brussel sprouts. My wife thought the cauliflower was good, I thought it was just average. We thought the pork belly bites, beet salad, and meat and cheese platters were good. Not one of us loved their entree. They did comp us for the apps because they came out after the entrees so we appreciated that.  Service was below average.  Food was below average.  We won't be returning.

g50EDSuv5HjWcF9ZwOJL4A.text: Unimpressed. Food was extremely overpriced. Paid $24 for a cut of steak that is $3.99 at Giant Eagle. It was served with "caramelized" Brussels sprouts that were hardly cooked, I've made them ten times better at home. We also got an order of fries that were served cold. I had high hopes for this place, but definitely will not be returning.

8BzzTCc202IjuGse1YEALw.text: Limited menu, a bit overpriced for what you're getting. My food was never brought out with the rest of the party, and I received my meal once everyone was finished. They did comp my dinner. The pork shoulder sandwich was just not good.  The burger was good once I got it.  Really nice cocktail selection - very tasty options.  Overall, I won't return. There are better options on the North Shore.

jpO_Cqzt94UPhB1lxGcpSg.text: Went here for a private event. Tim was our bartender and was amazing. We had smoked salmon, pork bellies, duck & the best pierogies, they were absolutely AMAZING! I would come back just for the pierogies.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

S0KYgffGE0oQCzdXGJxmFw.text: My wife and I stopped in here before a killer show at Stage AE last night. We chose this place because we weren't really interested in any of the others that are in that immediate area.  Atmosphere: It was about 6:00 and we were worried there might be a wait, but to our surprise the place looked empty when we walked in. Not a single person in the small dining and bar area, aside from the hostess. It was a little off putting at first, I'm not going to lie. While I don't like to wait long for a table, I also don't want to eat at a ghost town. We got seated right away, though, and the hostess led us back a hallway to the main seating area. There were a handful of other parties in the back, which was nice to see. The aesthetic of the place is rustic/industrial, which I like, even if it is over done at this point. They did some cool stuff I haven't seen before with it too, so I enjoyed peeping at those details. Pretty good tunes playing over the speakers as well. Could have done without the TV's on the wall next to my table, but I get it. Being so close to the stadiums, I'm sure they get a decent crowd of fans in there on game days. They have a really nice outdoor patio that overlooks the river, but it was cold and rainy when we were there, so maybe next time.  Food: The menu is on the smaller side, but I'm okay with that because they had several options I would have eaten, and I've  The read in other reviews that they change their offerings somewhat frequently. I ended up getting the Pickle-brined Fried Chicken Sandwich with fries and their homemade ranch (I'm assuming it was homemade because it wasn't typical and was very tasty). The sandwich was a good size, and if I wasn't going to the show directly, I probably would have only eaten half at the time, but I gorged myself instead. The chicken thick and super crispy which I dug. I was expecting more of a pickle taste, but it really wasn't there. Though, I suppose I'd rather it be too little than too much when it comes to pickle chicken. The sandwich had actual pickle chips on it and I think that's really where all the pickle flavor came from, not the "pickle-brined chicken". The fries we also good. Just a little too salty for me, but dipping them in that wonderful ranch helped with that. My wife got the Grilled Cheese with Bacon. I had a bite and the cheeses they used had great flavor together.   Drinks: Pretty good draft list. And they broke it all down by style, which is always super helpful to me. I got the Destihl Gose because why wouldn't I pair a sour beer with pickle chicken. Hind sight, it may have been a bit much, but since the pickle chicken wasn't all that pickly, it all worked out. They also had a large bottle selection, wine, and cocktails.   Overall, we had a good experience, and I'd probably go back again. Pricing was reasonable (totaled $31.xx plus tip) and the food was good. Hoping to check out that patio on a nice summer's eve.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Grilled Cheese (Lancaster cheddar, Boursin) with bacon.
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pickle-brined Fried Chicken sammy/frittes and ranch

1aTU9rgs-Yn9fEZOfrw4-A.text: A friend and I wanted to have a leisurely early dinner before a concert. When we first arrived, I was concerned as the front the the restaurant was empty...just like the several other times I passed by. We led into the back area, along the river walk, to be seated. Although it, too, was empty, it quickly filled up.  The meal was very good with duck fried nuts (you have to be careful how you say that) and pulled pork mac and cheese to start. My grilled cheese and bacon was excellent and I know my dining companion enjoyed her burger.  The best was that the server did not try to rush us and even encouraged us to take our time. Our goal of having a leisurely, and tasty, dinner was accomplished.

RQYw2DIsQma9NsP68hFpbw.text: Hi, My husband and I went to The Foundry this past Friday. We were greeted after seated by the most beautiful girl. Her name was Lisa. First she started telling us that it was her first weekend night that she was working. She made it a point to tell us if there was anything wrong to tell her immediately. We appreciated that since so many places that we use to frequent have gone down hill in the service category. Now the food. My husband and I both got the same thing. The Foundry Burger with the works. We both added bacon. He ordered his mooing and I ordered mine medium. All and all it was a pleasurable night out. We will definitely be back and certainly recommend to all of our friends.

jIoIKY_OfHxExOBCDpzJww.text: For the first time I've been here I would rate this establishment 5 stars. The food came out quickly, it was fresh and well prepared. The coffee was very good, the woman even put it in a to go cup for me! She also warmed it up and added a little more before I left. We were sharing plates and the food runner brought us more plates and was very pleasant.   Tonight we walked in with a party of seven, the hostess basically said we cannot seat you tonight. That is all she said, we asked if we were allowed to go to the back bar and her reply was "yeah, I guess". I was just disappointed, I thought she would have presented us with options as like splitting up our party and so forth. But she did not. We went to the back back and it was totally empty, which was great! We all sat down and the man bartending was super nice, friendly, had great recommendations and never left us with an empty drink. He even split the checks for us and didn't blink an eye when we asked. Tonight the food did not come out as perfect as the first time, I understand it was wayyyy busier than the first time but it was still good. The one girl who joined us for dinner said it was the best grilled cheese she ever had. I had pumpkin pierogies, and the market salad. My fiance had the pulled pork, he loved it as well!  I was surprised a 16 oz blue moon was $7.00, quite honestly the most I've ever seen blue moon be charged.   I understand we were in a high traffic area and they were busy, but the servers were running in front of guests and basically pushing them aside. I found that quite rude.   Definitely worth a try and I will look forward to coming back to give this place 5 stars!

O7UfrfdsMoqFizMIxzT22g.text: Pretty cool place right next to the river. I'll definitely come back. The bartender Ang is really nice and I had a good time!

bDInPltbhzyL9tH1h-f0ug.text: A reliable brunch spot that offers something on the menu to please everyone in the group. Good for a family meal, meeting up with friends, or a casual outing with colleagues. Highlights include solid brunch fare, Bloody Mary bar, ample room, friendly service, industrial decor, and plenty of TV sports coverage. The location features river views, seasonal outdoor seating, and easy walking to stadiums, Carnegie Science Center, and Stage AE. Parking is challenging, as it is for most North Shore destinations.

rzgJLa_bIbwvs8rG9a3X1Q.text: I was very excited to try this place out and I was pretty disappointed. I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich with the side of local greens. The sandwich was just fine and local greens was literally a bowl of spinach. A bowl of spinach. Nothing on it, nothing in it. Who likes to eat plain spinach?? Our waitress was attempting to be nice but she ended up just having a bad attitude the entire time. She argued with one of my friend's beer choice, insisting it was tapped when my friend just had a sample of it at the bar. Instead of checking for him he made him go back up to the bar to verify that they indeed had the beer he wanted. She asked in the beginning how we wanted our checks split, and verified that there were three separate checks. Once our bills came back they were completely messed up. We politely told her and she apologized and said she'd fix it, but instead of fixing it she came back, threw one bill on the table and told us to figure it out. This could have been a good experience but it definitely fell short.

PUNt-gcgBov6sQIYUXDXLA.text: Stopped into the Foundry before the Pitt home opener. The place is gorgeous. Small bar upfront with a rustic/industrial feel. Follow the hallway down and The Foundry just keeps revealing more of its awesome atmosphere. For such a large place, it feels quite intimate. Rotating beers on tap, wine and cocktail menu.  I ordered a Bloody Mary** which was mixed very well and my friend ordered a glass of wine. Nice selections to choose on the menu.  We opted for three small plates so we could maximize what we were trying. The roasted tomato pierogis were delicious. I never would have paired tomato in a pierogi. The sauerkraut side with it was a nice touch. I think adding two more pierogis to the dish for the price would be optimal.  The duck fried nuts...oh my. Totally decadent. A real treat! The thyme was a nice compliment. A little sea salt added to the dish would make that really pop! The pork belly bites. Let me tell you this...when there is pork (especially the belly) on a menu, I'm ordering it. These were definitely my favorite. The crispy edges topped with the fresh jalapeno made the perfect marriage! We sat at the bar and our service was excellent and I think the prices are somewhat fair.   Not bad at all for only being open a week! Can't wait to try more on the menu. If you're looking for great food and drink that's not going to break the bank in the North Shore, get here!   **The Bloody Mary was really good, but I think needs a signature garnish. Topping one of those with a lemon/lime, jalapeno, pork belly bite and either hot, pickled green bean or okra would really knock it out of the park!

Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pork Belly Bites...a must.

BxY4ZtYDsCU4rqmVujOGig.text: We were very disappointed with our visit. We ordered one beer, the 24 hour beef, and the restaurant week special with mushroom soup, pesto pasta and grilled peach dessert. It cost $67.60. The portions were *tiny* and tasted mediocre. We waited an hour to get our entrees. The beef was a small piece of over cooked and slightly dry meat. No sauce. No carbs. The pasta was a small bowl of pasta with pesto sauce. The dessert was a teaspoon of ice cream and a quarter of a cold peach with grill marks. The servers were brisk and inattentive. An hour and a half later all we had done was waste a lot of money. We stopped by taco bell to get food on our way home.

0Zx7-XosAyrlsRcfV1Q1Qg.text: Fresh food...awesome asparagus risotto! Small but plentiful beer selection. Cocktails were custom and appropriately priced. Nice find!

K3E3Et2NNzH6wWTrKCk2qg.text: Hit this place up after a Steelers Game! Although it was packed, we were greeted right away. The food was delicious and the drinks good as well Service was great!

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The grilled cheese with cauliflower and the cesar salad

6Bq_ISkjXqgxidImwqIX3g.text: This is their $12 beet salad. Barely a side salad. Would've been nice to know before we ordered two to go and got home to this. We actually laughed when we opened the boxes thinking they messed up our order. I'm not exaggerating when I say this is maybe a cup. We called them and they offered a refund on one of the salads. Hilarious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

C81r0rjKNuIgwCYqnFBl6Q.text: The beer and liquor list is extensive and up to date with current t trends.  We are here before a game and wanted to try a variety of appetizers.  The pork belly was the hit.  It has a nice spicy balance to the greasy pork with the jalapenos.  Next was the pimento cheese dip.  I expected it to be warm but it was not.  It was good but not amazing.  The pickled onions on the side did kick it up a notch but not enough to order again.  Last was the clams.  These were under whelming and had an overpowering pork taste.  It was so strong you could not taste anything else.  We also tried the deserts.  We had the ricotta cheese cake and the chocolate tart.  Both fell flat and lacked flavor and did not deliver on  the sweet that o crave after a meal.  The service was fine as to be expected.  A plus was the space.  This is a large place with nice outside seating.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Clams with the pimento dip in the background
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ricotta cheesecake
Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chocolate tart

bbPTD-1zMScIQdTfpIlNtA.text: Awesome venue! Messaged the manager ahead of time to see if they could accommodate a large party for my sister's birthday-they responded quickly and enthusiastically. Really impressed with their flexibility too; I had to call on three separate occasions to change the time for my ridiculously indecisive family members. :p This kindness extended into our dining experience: our server was the absolute best! She was very personable and acutely sensitive to a family member's special needs. Unfortunately, her name escapes me-otherwise I would shower her with compliments in this review. Regardless, I hope the management can use this as encouragement for their servers in the ongoing battle of customer service. :) All in all, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was chill. Ill def be back.

FddReZMDwIR5HB6pbAsWbQ.text: Atmosphere, beer/drink selection are awesome. Really feels like a nice place. The food however is not. Ordered Mac and cheese and the foundry burger and it was terrible. The food was not hot and really had no flavor. We were in a large party and half the party got and ate their food before the other half.  I would come back for a drink but not the food. Drinks are pricy too!

XKwUgWK8JwLsiN6ggScW7Q.text: Really nice open atmosphere and conveniently located right beside all of the baseball and football stadiums! I took a large group here for a work event and the restaurant very easily ensured a table for us large enough to accommodate our group even though it was also an evening of a local sports event. Really nice drink menu! Nice touch on American cuisine, will definitely venture back and explore more of the menu!

9TWGG3038fyvQ_hbyQXRAQ.text: So... Positives - place looks great, food is pretty good, drink list is pretty good... Overall a nice spot. HOWEVER, I'm here for the Pitt vs Penn St game and this place is HORRIBLY mismanaged. There is one poor bartender at a bar of about 300 customers. The crowd is way, way past Fire Marshall capacity! Like 'if something happens people will die' past capacity. It's ridiculous. We got here early enough to get a table and ordered food and drinks. The waitress said she couldn't get our second round because of the crowd, and doesn't see that changing anytime soon. It's been 30 mins... It's unfortunate to say, but places run this poorly never stay in business. Idk who spent all the money to open this place just to throw it away with mismanagement, but they did. Epic fail! Terrible.

photos.caption: Photo of The Foundry Table & Tap - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. People spilling out the back door, packed in this right throughout the whole bar

1zRWLU05GZNYbZQ7HKjtoQ.text: This place seems to be a big step up from the other chain restaurants surrounding the stadiums on the North Shore.  The Korean Fried Chicken was my personal favorite- the flavor was fantastic although I could see why some would say the prices are high for the portions. But when a place calls itself a gastropub I don't think that should be a surprise. The pickle-brined chicken was awesome (but definitely not enough chicken on that huge bun) and the french fries were some of the best around.  The beer selection was great from a visitor's perspective with quite a few local beers but a lot of the taps are full of the typical big breweries masquerading as craft brew. The major downside was that service took forever when we came in on a Monday at 1:30 and didn't get out of there until 3... I would hate to see what it would be like on a game day or any typical dining period.

JUAA6L4bbjXy9NIhP_qNdw.text: Nice place but service is horrible. The keep coming up with why things are slow and the issues they have, new bartender, short in the kitchen...., but that should not be customer facing. Still a neat place and a good location but I would think twice before I came back. If they get it together they have the potential to a great place but time will tell.
